Capitano, devo dirle che qualcuno dovrebbe insegnare a {s11} le buone maniere. Se non fosse stato per il mio autocontrollo, gli avrei gia tagliato la gola da tempo.
Capitano, devo dirle che qualcuno dovrebbe insegnare a {s11} le buone maniere. Se non fosse stato per il mio autocontrollo, gli avrei già tagliato la gola da tempo.
Capitano, devo dirle che qualcuno dovrebbe insegnare a {s11} le buone maniere. Se non fosse stato per il mio autocontrollo, gli avrei già tagliato la gola da tempo.
Il modo in cui fischietta allegramente mentre lo fa mi dà i brividi. Non è un nobile lavoro.

Il nemico ci stava facendo pressione, e lui disse: 'Fatti da parte, mercante, questo è un lavoro da cavaliere.' La prossima volta mi farò da parte, e gli permetterò di prendersi una lancia nello stomaco.

Alla fine della battaglia, mi sono messo a cercare tra i cadaveri qualche oggetto di valore. Non avevo raccolto che pochi oggetti quando {s11} mi arrivò alle spalle e me li strappò dalle mani dicendo che essendo stata lei ad uccidere quei nemici aveva il diritto di possedere i loro averi. Comandante, nella foga del combattimento, io non posso ricordarmi di aver ucciso questo o quel nemico. Se {s11} me lo avesse semplicemente chiesto le avrei lasciato tutto senza problemi.
Io sono un sangue nobile, lui è un popolano. Deve solo stare al suo posto!

Cercando tutto quello che ci potesse essere di valore tra i cadaveri, al termine della battaglia, trovai nella borsa di un nemico una padella di buona fattura. Ho sempre desiderato una padella del genere, così da poter cucinare lo stufato che la mia gente usava preparare per scaldarsi le budella durante l'inverno. Ma Brynden me la strappò violentemente dalle mani e mi disse che quella padella non poteva essere macchiata da cibo pagano, detto questo, se ne andò con la mia padella. Questa volta, ho lasciato che finisse così, ma non sono disposto a tollerare oltre.
Niente.
Back when I lived in my lord grandfathers castle, I saw many a thief hanged. This man looks like those thieves.
As we were cleaning our weapons, he almost hacked off my head when he stumbled!

Apprezzo il fatto che sia disposto a rischiare la sua vita in battaglia, ma questo non fa di lui un lord. Non è di nobili origini e la sua famiglia ha creato la propria ricchezza con il commercio e l'usura. Può essere un buon soldato ausiliario, ma non dovrebbe provare a rubare la gloria della vittoria a un vero combattente.

Nell'ultima battaglia, continuava a gridarmi: 'Vai avanti, vai indietro, tieni la posizione.' Quando gli risposi di pensare alla sua di posizione sul campo, mi rispose che mi avrebbe fatto frustare per la mia insolenza. Chiedo perdono comandante, ma se continuerà in questo modo, credo che si troverà una freccia piantata nello stomaco.

Mi disse che era una preghiera di ringraziamento per la vittoria, ma non sembrava proprio una preghiera. Comandante, non vorrei che in quel modo risvegliasse i fantasmi dei morti per portarci sventura. Penso che dobbiate liberarvi di lui.

Comandante, se quell'uomo conoscesse l'etica nel campo medico, saprebbe che non si deve mai minare la fiducia del paziente nei confronti del proprio dottore, specialmente durante un'operazione complicata. Se foste così gentile da congedarlo dalla nostra Compagnia, rendereste un gran servigio a tutti.
When all the dust settled, {s11} turned on me and told me not to 'tempt the wrath of the Heavens' with my 'hubris.'
{Signore/Signora}, sfidare il proprio superiore può influenzare negativamente la disciplina della truppa, lo farò frustare se ci riprova!

{s11} ha detto che Gerardys era un antiquato ignorante. Comandante, nessun vero dottore puo' mancare di rispetto ai grandi maestri del passato. Io non credo che dobbiate avvalervi di uno che è chiaramente un impostore.

Alla fine del nostro ultimo scontro, mi sono messo a  'rovistare'  tra le vesti di un nemico morto, nel caso nascondesse qualcosa di prezioso. Lui mi ha detto che sono una bestia. Potrei 'ispezionare' le sue viscere se non impara a tenere a freno la lingua...

His attitude begins to irritate me. He might be of noble birth, but he has done nothing to earn his titles. Staying out of a fight to keep his armor shiny, complaining when his weapons get dirty: this arrogant prick is trouble all along.

He has been to my village years ago, where he helped the village elder to obtain even more women to kill.  I told him I recognized him, so he struck me down to silence me.  No-one noticed in the heat of battle. Please, my dear {sir/madame}, don't let that monster anywhere near me again.

After our last victory -- the Heavens be praised -- I spotted her going through the dead bodies of our fallen foes, without paying the proper respect they deserve. When I tried to correct her, she just looked sheepishly at me, only to burst out in curses afterwards. You wouldn't believe the things she said to me!  She's bad luck, I say you, and will bring misfortune over our company. It'd be best to leave her at the next heathen village.

I had pinned down an opponent, who begged me for mercy. It was that moment I recognised him as one of the former servants from my father's palace. Tears ran down our cheeks upon this spark of recognition, and I gave him my word to let him live if he fled the battlefield. After this was said, that monster of a {s11} stepped in and slit his throat without a warning! I'm afraid to sleep anywhere near him, my friend. It'd be best to let him go.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.

After the last battle she insulted me beyond any words, saying that I'd better be one of her servants, else I would be as good as dead. IF I hadn't turned my back on her and silenced myself, it would have surely ended bad for her. I can't guarantee that I'll have as much self control next time.
My liege. Ser Jasper back there didn't do badly in that last fight at all. He's a good man, too.
Your grace. I just wanted to tell you that Saathos may be a rough sort, and possibly quite mad, and I'll venture he's a thoroughgoing rogue as well, but I'm proud to call him my companion.
Hello, {my lord/my lady}! I had just wanted to tell you that Berengar is a most gallant man. Did you see him in our last battle?
Perdono, {Signore/Signora}. Volevo solo esprimere il mio apprezzamento per Bilaquo. Si è comportato molto bene nell'ultima battaglia.
Questa è stata una bella battaglia, {playername}. Jasper è un ottimo soldato, da avere al proprio fianco in combattimento.
{My lord/My lady}! Sometimes I am troubled by all this bloodshed, although I know that proud lords must be humbled, and cruel men tamed, if we are to restore peace to the realm.
Stavo parlando con Ser Bennis. Può sembrare un pò selvaggio, ma credo che sia un amico fedele.
A fine battle that was, my liege. And I have to say, I admire the taunts that Martyn hurled at our enemy. They where quite witty.
Comandante. Bilaquo se l'è cavata bene nell'ultimo combattimento. È un uomo modesto, se posso dire la mia.

Ahoy, {playername}! I wish you joy of your victory! Say, Maron is not bad in a scrap, is he, for a man of his trade? Although I'm getting to be a bit of an old dog myself for this, he might yet learn a proper way of life.
Accidenti, comandante! Una battaglia come questa fa scricchiolare le mie vecchie giunture. In ogni caso, gli abbiamo dato una bella lezione, no?
Un affare maledetto, comandante, un affare maledetto. Sebbene certamente necessario. Maron, credo che possiate comprendere la mia condotta ambivalente in questa lotta senza fine.
Avete onorato il vostro nome oggi, mio valoroso comandante! E anche Clavis! Mi piace. Canta le canzoni della sua gente quando va in battaglia, ha un animo artistico come il mio.
{playername}. È un piacere scendere in battaglia con uomini come Roger al mio fianco!
{playername}. Stavo scambiando due parole con Halbert dopo l'ultima battaglia, e mi ha davvero colpito. È una persona con la testa sulle spalle.
I was just having a chat with Drollo, as we picked through the bodies after our last little scrap.

{playername}, while I was fighting in the frontline this battle I got finally a chance to speak to Serol. What a revelation it was to hear his story: I feel like I could write many poems about his exploits.

Have I been wrong? I thought that everyone in the whole world was out there to kill me, you excluded of course, but now that I have spoken to Ser Roger, I'm not sure about that. He seems so nice and understanding.
The Heavens be praised that you enlisted Gyrnir in your company. He's a good fighter, and clearly tries to live a moral life, just like me.
amico mio, è bello combattere a fianco Ser Jasper. Lui è un coraggioso, e soprattutto, un uomo d'onore.
My liege, have you heard Alyns story? About the abuse of power by his village elder? Her tale made my blood boil. How I wish I was there to tell him what I think of him.
{playername}, have you seen Alyn? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
{playername}, have you seen {s11}? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
{playername}, have you seen {s11}? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
{playername}, have you seen {s11}? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
{playername}, have you seen {s11}? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
{playername}, have you seen {s11}? Ah, he's a handsome man, is he not? Makes a woman wish to put away the mace and pick up the gown.
Senza anime oneste come lui che portano luce in questo mondo, i cavalieri come me avrebbero una vita molto dura, ve lo garantisco. Sono felice di averlo con noi.
Visto ciò che ha fatto in quest'ultima battaglia, mi sento in dovere di dargli fiducia, anche se devo ancora tenere la mano sulla borsa, ha ha hah!
Confesso anche che trovo in lui un compagno davvero piacevole, un uomo di spirito e buone maniere. Forse, forse... Ah, ma sto dicendo troppo, buona giornata {playername}.

Avete scelto bene arruolando anche lui nella nostra Compagnia. Conosce una o due cosette valide riguardo al combattimento. Inoltre, a differenza di altri che potrei citare, conosce il rispetto verso i compagni d'armi.
Come per gli altri suoi attributi, dubito che possa essere considerato un cavaliere più di quanti ho incontrato.
I must say that Halbert is a source of great comfort to me. I have told him of my past sins, and he told me that the Father is sure to forgive me.
Ser Bennis is a true knight. I've been discussing the intricacies of handling the peasants, and he quite agrees with me, that we ought to punish them more often!

He managed to include their geneology, their appearance, and their eating habits in a well-framed Old Valyrian quatrain. I personally prefer the saga, but we northerners respect poetic craftwork when we hear it.
Mi piace quest'uomo. E' un buon compagnio!
Heh. È lì a dimostrare che non basta essere giovani per vincere una battaglia, l'esperienza è tutto. Potrei prenderla e insegnare a questi cuccioli una cosa o due, no?
Ser Roger in particular showed them a thing or two, I thought. Not bad for the pair of us, I think between us we killed half the enemies that came towards us!
It saddens him deeply to take the lives of his fellow men, however just the cause. He and I have talked together of a brighter future, where in the realm is not shattered by war.
I'm sure that in this splendid company, we'll all end up lords by the end of our days!
È un grande soldato e, anche se non è veloce come altri, sa come tenere in riga i suoi uomini. Avete fatto un'ottima scelta a portarlo nella nostra Compagnia.

La guerra, come qualsiasi altro affare, richiede pianificazione, preparazione e una solida conoscenza dei princìpi strategici. A parità di condizioni, l'esercito con una disposizione migliore degli uomini vincerà in battaglia, un'osservazione che non credo possa essere smentita dalla nostra ultima battaglia. Quegli uomini lo staranno maledicendo ora, ma impareranno a ringraziarlo, ve l'assicuro.
Have you heard of this Dothraki people? Fascinating stories he tells.
To hear him tell it, he had to fight a hundred men to escape Pentos!
I've heard tales of the knights of the green lands, but I never expected him to be so genial and honest.
His story might seem unbelievable -- especially with the way he fights, which I recognized last battle -- but at least he shook his old shackles off and tries to find a better way in life.
When I talked to Ser Jasper after our last battle, I understood that he's been far away from home too. I feel we are similar souls, and destined to be friends, my friend.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I feel sorry for him. But I'm glad that there is at least one soul in this company that really understands me.
I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there, both in my bed and in the fields.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there.
Maybe it's the way he talks, or the way he walks. I'll have to bring him back to Bear Island, he'd do well there.

Sono stanco di marciare in lungo e in largo per le campagne, usate il mio sangue per la causa di qualcun altro. Il bottino è buono, ma ora ne ho abbastanza. Ho intenzione di tornare al mio villaggio, prendere moglie e aumentare i miei beni, se posso permettermelo.

I'm getting a bit tired of the warrior's life. I'm going to invest my share of our loot into a cargo of goods -- furs, linens, velvets, fine Arbor wines probably -- and take them back to Slaver's Bay. I'd warrant the dragon queen would have a taste of Westerosi wine. I would like to thank you again for taking me on, and wish you the best of luck.
I am afraid I have something to tell you. I have decided that the warrior's life is not for me. I think I'll join the Faith, and become a septon.

Ho combattuto con voi con onore, come si addice a un figlio della casata di Paton, ma non sono del tutto soddisfatto del vostro comando. Voglio tornare a casa, dove hanno più bisogno dei miei servigi.

{playername} -- Dal momento che sono stato arruolato da voi, ho combattuto ferocemente e lealmente. Ma non avete sempre ricambiato i miei servigi come avrei voluto. Torno a casa, voglio rivedere mio padre, mia moglie, i miei figli, i miei zii, i miei nipoti, i miei fratelli e le mie sorelle.

Sono entrato in questa Compagnia nella speranza di uscire dalle tenebre, e qui ho trovato una sorta di pace. Ho qualche riserbo sul vostro comando, e penso di poter trovare in altri modi il percorso della mia redenzione.

Sono stanco di questa squallida vita di guerra continua, vedere uomini degradati dalla paura, l'avidità, la lussuria, e un centinaio di altri peccati. Ho qualche soldo nella mia borsa. Me ne vado oltremare a cercare posti migliori di questa terra. Spero riuscirete a cavarvela senza di me.

Ho combattuto bene sotto il vostro comando. ma la vostra guida non mi è sempre piaciuta, inoltre ho altri affari da sbrigare. Saccheggerò ciò che ho conquistato e solleverò una guerra civile al nord per salvare l'onore di mio marito da quel traditore di mio cognato. Vi auguro buona fortuna.
Abbiamo combattuto bene insieme, e conquistato la gloria. Ho qualche riserva sul vostro comando, e ho un patrimonio da reclamare. Me ne vado, forse ci incontreremo ancora.

I've had enough of tromping up and down the length and breadth of the world. I've got enough to buy a small bit of land somewhere, perhaps close to the Greenblood, so I think I'll give that a try. So long, and best of luck to you.
You did a lowborn man a great service by taking him into your company. But I'm afraid I'm finding that this life is not to my liking.

Ho sempre servito bene nella vostra Compagnia. Ho riempito la pancia, messo qualche soldo in borsa, e ampliato la mia conoscenza di ferite e lesioni... Non posso lamentarmi di questo! Ma credo proprio che per me la militanza in questa Compagnia sia finita. Ho il dovere di condividere le mie scoperte con altri cerusici, e per questo ho bisogno di arruolare qualche scrivano, merce rara da queste parti. Torno a casa.

Come la lucentezza del vostro nome cresce sempre più brillante, temo che la mia reputazione sembri pallida a confronto, come la luna viene offuscata dal sole. Ho deciso di andarmene. Vi auguro buona fortuna!
Vorrei informarvi che ho intenzione di scindere il nostro rapporto. Voglio cercare un'occupazione alternativa.

Ho apprezzato il fatto che mi avete portato con voi, ma non sono soddisfatto di come sono andate le cose. Ho intenzione di andarmene altrove... Magari torno a casa, magari trovo un altro lavoro, non ho ancora deciso.
Ho vissuto bei momenti in questa Compagnia, e ho trovato qualche gingillo utile sul campo di battaglia, ma ora come ora qualcosa non funziona. Vado a offrire altrove il mio talento.

It was good to fight alongside you, but the time has come to invest the money you gave me. I hope that you have learned from my company, and maybe one day we can team up again. Maybe then the roles of commander and hireling will be reversed.

I'm sorry, {playername}, but I'm afraid I can't stay any longer with your band. I've lost my trust in your companions and don't dare to risk them handing me over to my father. I thank you for your kindness.
Ah, {playername}, it grieves me so to say this, but I must retire from adventuring with you. My discoveries must be catalogued.
I'm sorry, but the Heavens have shown me a different path than the one you are taking. I'm afraid we'll have to part here. If we have enough faith, our paths may one day cross each other again.

We've seen the world together, haven't we, my friend? But I'm afraid our paths have to part  this day. I've found a trace of my father's servants. I want to follow them, in the hope I might find a way back to the old days, and bring my people back under my banner. Unfortunately it lands to the opposite direction of where you're heading. May our paths once cross each other again!

Where are you heading, {playername}? I picked up a trail of those vile nobles, and they went that way. Ah, well, I'll just go my own way if I can't convince you to come along to that direction. It isn't like you ever listened to my suggestions after all...
Ah, {playername}, I'm afraid I'll have to return to mother. It's been far too long, and I've seen enough of the world.
Ah, {playername}, I'm afraid I've gotten too old for this kind of life. I think I'll return to Chelsted, and live out my days.
Look, {playername}, an apple! REND THE FLESH, REND, REND, REND, spill the blood!
Ho finito.
Ho finito.
Ho finito.

Comandante, è bello rivedervi. So che abbiamo avuto le nostre divergenze in passato, ma per dire la verità, sono stati i giorni migliori che abbia mai vissuto. E ho avuto qualche problema a trovare un lavoro. Se lo vorrete, sarò felice di combattere ancora sotto il vostro vessillo.

{Signore/Signora}! È bello rivedervi. Ma lo confesso... Vi stavo cercando. Come vi ho detto ho comprato molte merci, e le ho portate in lungo e in largo per il regno, ma forse non lo sapete, sono stato attaccato da una banda di corsari, fuori Volantis, e ho perso tutto. Penso di essere destinato a lottare per il mio patrimonio. Ho sentito che avete raccolto fortuna. Quindi ditemi, {playername}, vorreste riavermi con voi?

Beh, salute {signore/signora}! è bello rivedervi. Ho paura di non essermela cavata molto bene da quando ci siamo separati. La famiglia di mia madre, su cui contavo, non mi ha dato nessun aiuto per la mia impresa di commercio. Non ho ricevuto niente, se non qualche ramanzina da mia zia su come ho rovinato il mio matrimonio con prospettive di assunzione da parte di una Compagnia di mercenari. Forse rendo meglio nella guerra che nel commercio, condividere un pasto dietro un fuoco con rozzi combattenti è più adatto a me che bere vino con la borghesia di Oldtown. {playername}, vi devo chiedere... Vorreste che tornassi al vostro servizio?

Salve, {mio signore/mia signora}. Ne è passato di tempo... Ho sentito che avete accumulato gloria e fortuna. Per quel che riguarda me, ho avuto qualche problema a mantenere le mie proprietà... Locuste, piogge sfavorevoli, contadini indisciplinati... Insomma, questo genere di cose. Ho pensato che potrei prendere in mano la spada ancora una volta. So che c'è stato qualche problema tra di noi, ma sarei onorato di poter combattere ancora al vostro fianco.
{playername}! Your fame grows ever greater -- even as far as my fathers keep. I've come back again, hoping you might forget any harsh words I had spoken, to see if I could fight with you once again.
It is good to see you, {playername}. Everywhere I go, men are in awe of your deeds. I have not had it so well since I left.  Will you allow me to serve with you once again?

{Mio signore/Mia sognora}! è bello vedervi. Dimenticate quello che posso aver detto quando ci siamo divisi. Mi sono unito a una carovana fuori da Approdo del Re, diretto verso Horn Hill, ma sono stato preso dai banditi e dopo aver pagato il riscatto sono stato riportato indietro. Possono esserci posti migliori al mondo rispetto questo, ma io devo ancora vederli. Se la mia condanna è vivere qui, allora la vostra Compagnia è un buon posto dove stare. Mi vorreste ancora con voi?

Greetings to you, {playername}. I was wondering if the harsh words spoken between us in the past could be forgotten. I could not find enough men to crew a longship, and those whom I gathered quickly got bored and wandered off -- not, I will add, before they drank away such gold as I had accumulated. So I thought back to the battles we fought together. Those were good days, and profitable ones too.

Salve {playername}! Che bello rivedervi! Ho cercato di essere assunto al servizio dei signori di questa terra, ma mi sentivo insoddisfatto. Metà di loro mi chiedeva di riscuotere debiti dagli altri signori, neanche fossi un banchiere, o portargli indietro il bestiame rubato, come se fossi un mandriano. Uno mi ha chiesto di uccidere uno dei suoi creditori! Ho cercato di voi, nella speranza che mi rivoleste ancora al vostro servizio.

Comandante! è bello rivedervi. Sapete, ho scoperto di non essere tagliato per il lavoro dell'agricoltore. Troppo tranquillo lavorare sulle spalle dei braccianti. Penso che il combattimento sia la cosa che conosco meglio. Ditemi, comandante, state ancora cercando bravi uomini?

Comandante! è bello rivedervi! Si dice che avete accumulato ricchezze inenarrabili. Sono un vecchio sacco di ossa irrequieto, lo ammetto. Ho lasciato la Compagnia perché non ero soddisfatto della vita da guerriero, ma ho passato del tempo in città e mi sono reso conto che ci sono cose peggiori nella vita di una pancia piena, compagni onesti, e il sentirsi vivo perché vedi correre i tuoi nemici verso di te. Vi prego, prendetemi ancora con voi!

{playername}! It's a fine thing to see an honest face like yours. This world is full of lies. I went home to publish my findings, hired some scribes and made a handful of codices, and waited for the commissions. But it turns out that the Citadel don't care about real medical knowledge rather than warmed-over Gerardys. And publishers -- let me tell you, you never saw anyone so unscrupulous. They rent the books out chapter to by chapter to apprentices to copy, but half of them aren't returned, and those that are have pages soaked in wine, and there's no longer a complete copy of my work anywhere. I'll keep trying, but first I need a bit of money in my pocket. Are you looking for a man trained in the Citadel?

Salve, comandante. Speravo di rivedervi ancora. Ovunque vada, sento leggende e canzoni sulle vostre imprese. Ammetto di sentire una fitta di rimpianto da quando le nostre strade si sono divise e, lo confesso, una fitta di gelosia per la vostra notorietà. Ho pensato che potrei combattere ancora al vostro fianco, vivendo di luce riflessa dalla vostra gloria. Potremmo forse cavalcare ancora insieme, almeno per un po'?

{playername}! It is good to see you. When last we parted, I was ready to swear that I would not serve you again, but perhaps I judged you too harshly. All over, men sing your praises. I have tried serving in other lords' armies, and believe me, what I have seen of them restores my opinion of your leadership. As my father taught me to say 'Ki jini anha astak asqoy, anha, Drollo ki Ogo'. If you would have me in your company, I would fight for you again.

Salve, {playername}. Non posso dire di essere del tutto dispiaciuto di vedervi. Vedete, ho sottoscritto un altro contratto prima di lasciarvi, e quando è arrivato il momento di prendere la paga, il lord non ebbe altro da darmi se non parole, scuse e critiche alla mia opera. Non ero sempre felice nella vostra Compagnia, ma almeno dopo ogni battaglia riuscivo a mettere un poco d'oro nella mia bisaccia. Mi offrireste ancora lavoro?
{My lord/My lady}! I find myself lordless, having bedded the daughter of my last lord. Mayhaps you seek to hire brave knights?

{playername}! It's been a while since we last spoken. I still remember the smell of the battlefields you led us on, the sound of coins exchanging ownership as we traded our way from city to city and the feeling of rescpect we earned with each move we made. Things are going easy for me lately. Too easy. The money is soundly invested, and I've got some men working on my farms. For me there's nothing left to do. What do you think, shall we revive old times?

What a cruel world it is out there! No one believes me, and they all want to return me to my father. Like that will do any good. {playername}, could you show me your mercy once again and let me join your protection once more?
Ah, {playername}. Good to see you. Mind if I join you again?
The Heavens be praised that we meet again. It is so much easier to stay at the right path in your company. I now know that for sure. If you still appreciate me, I'd like to join your side once again.
How fortunate I find you back, my friend! The trace I followed only led to a dead end. If you won't mind, I'd rather join your side again and travel the world together, like we used to do.

Ah, {playername}. I'd hate to admit it, but you were right. The trace I followed led to nowhere. I'd like to join your company again, and this time I promise to heed your words more than I used to do.
Ah, {playername}. Still travelling around the world, are you? I'd like to rejoin your merry band of rogues, if you don't mind.
Aiutatemi, {playername}! Ho speso tutti i soldi che avevo!
Aiutatemi, {playername}! Dove sono?
I guess I'll join you again.
I guess I'll join you again.
I guess I'll join you again.
{playername}! Queste sono le rovine infestate di Harrenhal!
Ci stiamo avvicinando Pentos. Ecco dove ero diretto quando quel demone dalle orecchie enormi ha preso la mia nave!

Lo sentite quest'odore? Alberi di limone, mele e fiori di ciliegio, il profumo di Oldtown. Ho passato tante estati felici qui quand'ero giovane, giocando nei prati con la famiglia di mia madre mentre mio padre era via per combattere come mercenario.
Ah, Volantis. Astapor is certainly the greatest city in the world, but I concede that Volantis has a certain charm. At least the slaves of this place knows to respect the old blood.
{playername}! That over there is the pool that Florian saw Jonquil and the six maidens bathe themselves in!
Guardate, {playername}! Quello è il grande castello di Casterly Rock, residenza dei Lannister!
Guardate, {playername}, su quella collina! Sono le torri gemelle del castello dei miei nonni!
Hmf. Do you hear that? The silence and the gulls. Do you see the desolation and the bleakness? We're close to the Fingers, the most godforsaken place in the world.
Eccola! La baia di Braavos, la più puzzolente, sporca, brutta tra tutte le baie!

D'you smell that fresh air, {playername}? This was my home, before I went in search of coin and battles, in that order. It's good to be up close to the river again. It's the smell of freedom. This is the cradle of Dorne, here at the outskirts of Planky Town.
Vedo le montagne. Dobbiamo essere vicino a casa.
Stiamo passando per il posto in cui ho ottenuto i miei migliori trionfi in medicina, se v'interessa.

Ah, the ruins of Castamere! Such a lovely castle it once was, supposedly, at the foot of the Mountains. I'm sure you're familiar with the tale of Lord Reyne? You have, without a doubt, heard that song Lord Tywin had made after his destruction of the castle.
Vedete quella città lassù, oltre la valle? Norvos? Ho passato qui un inverno qualche anno fa, cercando di addestrare alle armi gli uomini del posto.

Vedete quel castello in cima alla collina? Viene chiamato castello Ten Towers. Ho lavorato lì per un po', non troppo tempo fa. Alla vista non è imponente come altri castelli del regno, ma è costruito con la più bella pietra che io abbia mai visto.
Ecco, {playername}, vedede quelle? Queste sono le pietre di Re Mud. Siamo vicini al luogo dove sono nato.
Tyrosh... One of the few cities where I haven't been run out by an enraged magister and his dirty guard.
Devo avvertirvi, {playername}. Dietro queste colline si trova Blackhold, il villaggio da dove sono scappato.
'In the darkness, smoke falls like rain! The flames are cold!' An old man once told me that. Ah, I have no idea what it means.
Sorrows... Casa dei banditi, ma anche di molto, molto peggio.
Ah, my friend: the town of Lys. The place my forefather nearly burned to the ground.
Guardate {playername}! Vulture's Roost!
Guardate {playername}! Winterfell!
Look {playername}! That's Chelsted!
Guardate {playername}! Ho già visto questo posto! GIOCATE CON I TESCHI!
{playername}, that over there is the Whispers.
Ah, the Dreadfort. Or, well, most people would run screaming from this place. Not go 'ah', as if they're awed by it. Though I guess you would be awed by the Dreadfort, it's big. Nasty place though.
That's Tumbleton over there. Dreadful place. The whores are old, the wine older and the dice filled with lead.

Truth be told, the stories of Harrenhal are vastly exaggerated. The ghosts of Harren the Black and his sons haunting the castle, engulfed in flames, and mad lady Lothston sending out bats to bring home naughty children for her cookpots, bah!.

People say that the Pentoshi are a bunch of treacherous money-grubbers, but they have a good head for trade, if you ask me. They make the people up and down the coast grow flax, which they weave here into linen. It can't compete with Volantene silks and velvets as a luxury fabric, but it makes good summertime wear and you can use it for the sails of ships. More importantly, linen was one of the few goods that someone else in Essos wasn't already making, if you can believe that.

Oldtown vive di inverni bagnati ed estati calde, ma la gente qui costruisce grandi cisterne d'acqua per le colture. Coltivano viti, il vino di Oldtown è famoso, {signore/signora}... E chi può permetterselo costruisce giardini, dove alberi da frutto crescono in abbondanza, e in cui noi passiamo le serate ascoltando musica, giocando a scacchi o, più semplicemente, apprezzando i profumi dell'aria notturna.

While my house has never traded extensively with the Volantenes, I still think favorably of them. They know how keep their filthy slaves in check! And they train the best sluts outside of Lys. I myself once had the pleasure of experiencing a whore trained in the ways of the seven sighs. What a night, though her cunt was much too used for my taste.
Imagine that! Riding along from tourney to tourney, never loosing a match, and on top of that, you spot the fairest maidens in the land, naked as the day they where born!
Che vista impossinante! Ho visto molti dei castelli di Westeros, ma non ne ho mai visto uno paragonabile a questo!

Look at those high walls, and well-guarded crenelations. Truly, the Crossing is one of the greatest castles in Westeros! I used to swim in that river as a child, and I had my first woman in those trees over there.

You haven't heard of this place? No surprise. The Fingers is the most remote part of the Vale of Arryn, and while they might have been somewhat pleasant once, they certainly are not today. During one of the frequent wars between the King in the North and the King of Mountain and Vale, a northern army landed on The Fingers, and systematically raped, pillaged and burned everything in sight. The Fingers have been a desolate place ever since.

The Braavosi is a vile bunch, all of them descended from slaves, none of them washing more than once a day. Hmf, I shudder to even think of it. And they don't allow slavery! Even impossed it on Pentos, in that war they won through treachery and deceit!

In the days of my ancestors, when Valyria still ruled the world, the Rhoynar led an army against the dragonlords. They were utterly obliterated, and so Queen Nymeria sailed, with all her people, across the Narrow Sea and landed in Dorne, where she took Mors Martell as her husband and brought all of Dorne under their joint rule.

I'm from a small village close to Horn Hill. You know the saying, {playername} -- 'Barley grown in Horn Hill is made into ale in Oldtown, and we're all the better for it.' Not sure what that means, {playername}, but it's true about the barley. And wheat, and oats. We grow more grain here in the shadow of the Tarlys than all the rest of Westeros put together, and our ale is the best, too. You can see it in the soil here -- rich and black, and smells of good harvests and full bellies.

The old knight of Stonedance, Ser Meribald Massey, had the dropsy, and had requested a maester from Oldtown to treat him. Like a typical citadel-educated healer, he went right to Ellendor for a cure. Ellendor recommends mercury for dropsy. Now, most of Ellendor's writings were useless back in the days of the Targaryen kings, when they were first written down, and they're doubly worthless today, but sometimes he hits upon the right cure by chance: mercury does cure some kinds of dropsy in small doses. However, mercury in large doses is poison, something that the Ellendor-worshippers never grasped.

They say lord Tywins father was a foolish and weak man. Though they do not say that to Tywin Lannister. Anyhow, the lords Reyne and Tarbeck rebelled against their liege lord, though I forget why. Probably due to some silly thing, like a woman or gold.

I say 'trying' because in my opinion, Norvoshi don't take well to discipline. Finest archers you ever saw, and good riders too, but they have no stomach for fighting in ranks. Their skills serve them well enough against brigands and sellswords, particularly when they can hide behind walls, but the Dothraki can match them arrow for arrow, and I've seen a khalasar cut through their infantry like a knife through butter.

Like most castles that last around here, it's got foundations that are as old as the land itself. You can't see them any more with all the rebuilding, but the slabs are the size of a house. They must have utilized giants back in those days, because I don't see how they moved those things otherwise. Beautiful location, too -- Ten Towers sits right in front of the mines of Harlaw, which allows the lord to charge a pretty penny in tolls.

Supposively, those stones where set up by old king Mudd, who ruled the Riverlands thousands of years ago. He was supposed to be unbeatable in battle, but he lost his last one. Took an arrow through the nose. His castle was named... well, no one knows, but we call the remains Oldstones.

Before I met you, I travelled for a few months through Essos. Lords and ladies flocked to hear me sing! But alas, the rulers of the Free Cities are a jealous bunch! They always found some reason to throw me out of their manses, be it my beautiful voice or the effect I had on their beautiful daughters.

It used to be a prosperous place amidst the rocks. We all respected and loved our village elder, like he deserved. He always traveled hence and forth between the neighboring villages, to improve our standing. One day he had forgotten something, and returned early, only to find his wife in bed with a large thrall. Immediately he swung his sword and killed them both.
The same man sold me an excellent manticore shell though, so it was not an entirely useless discovery.

These are the ruins of Chroyane, the Festival City. That over there is the Bridge of Dreams, and the large palace, or the ruins of a large palace, is the former Palace of Love. Chroyane was the pride of the Rhoynar.
I hear that the Lyseni still hold an annual offering, to celebrate the fact that the entire city did not perish in that dreadful fire. Truly, wildfire is demon work.
Vulture's Roost was the seat of the Vulture King. He rose up in rebellion during the reign of Daeron the Second, proclaiming himself king.
Winterfell has been the seat of the Starks for thousands of years. Bran the Builder raised it with the help of magic and crowned himself the first King in the North.
People say this is where Aemon the Dragonknight was born! And my uncle used to tell me how Garth Greenhand was buried beneath our farm!
Where do I know this place from, {playername}? What are we doing here?
It's where the Kings of Crackclaw Point used to have their seat. Some of the smallfolk tell a silly story about wizards, severed heads and giant knights when they hear about the place.
The Boltons arguably have a reputation that's worse than reality, but that Roose... and his bastard... they're not very nice people is what I'm getting at.

But that's to be expected. The people still wail over the Sack. And it's been almost two hundred years! To hear the locals tell it, 'twas only a fortnight ago that the Betrayers descended on the town with their dragons.

Still, there's no denying that every house to hold the castle has met with an unfortunate end. House Hoare, Qoherys, Strong, Harroway, Lothston are all gone, and I hear that lady Whent has died as well. Murdered, more like it, when the Lannisters took the castle. Yes, the castle might not be haunted, but it's a bad place even so, {playername}.

I had loaded up on saffron, cinnamon, cloves, peppers and other spices and a chest full of fine Arbor vine. I estimated that I could buy linens, furs, velvet, iron and wool, and the extra ships to carry them back, and I'd still make a profit. I just hadn't figured in lord Stannis, who apparently don't care for the common man.

The poets call Oldtown the most beautiful city in the world, and I think for once that they do not exaggerate. How could they, with the Citadel, the Starry Sept and the Hightower right in front of them!

The city is ruled by the elected triarchs, three each year. Ever since the Bleeding Years, and the War of Dominion, the Volantenes have kept to their trade and stayed out of war, in no great part thanks to the squabbling of the triarchs.

I guess some men are truly favored by the gods. Say, did you ever hear the story about Florian the Fool, and his fair maiden Jonquil? No? I don't believe it, every child in Westeros have heard that tale at one point or another! Florian was a brave and homely knight, who one day spied the fair Jonquil bathing in this very pool. He was so captivated that he set out to slay the King of Cracklaw Point, who had been terrorizing the countryside, to gain her favor. When he finally completed his quest, Jonquils father gave him her hand in marriage, but a year later they where both dead! The King had sons, and they stormed in at the wedding feast, intent on revenge. Florian managed to kill all three of them, but not before Jonquil had been hit by an arrow. Consumed by grief, he fell on his own sword!

They say that the caverns beneath the keep is filled with weapons, vaults stacked with golden coins and supply rooms filled with years worth of provisions. And look at the surrounding land! Never have I seen such rich grape groves, or such well-tended fields of wheat.

Truly, these lands are the most prosperous and well-governed in all of Westeros! Oh, did I mention that already? Excuse me, but I feel a special kinship with these rolling hills and deep forests, after all, my father is a trueborn son of lord Walder Frey!

The singers say that it was in retaliation for King Harrold and his men abducting and raping the bethroted of King Edderion, the one they called The Bridegroom. I don't care either way, but they could have left a few trees to smoother this blasted wind!

Pah, I can smell that swampy city now, it's like a day old fish that's been raped by a scallop! We better avoid this town, {playername}, one is sure to catch a sudden case of slashed throat if I have to stay near this dirty place.

Look at how the Orphans sail their painted ships up and down the river. It's customary for the children to meet travellers with songs and dancing, and they are generally a peaceful sort. They mostly trade up and down the river, picking fruits, selling dyes and doing the odd farm job. And the have astonishing knowledge of the healing arts, many of their midwives being more skilled than even the maesters.

Truth be told, I can't quite remember why I left in the first place. Hah! Of course I can! The whores in these parts are old and wrinkled, and their cunts as dusty as the prison of Jak o' the Shadows, heh. Whatever that means. As I told you, {playername}, this land is old, and many of the sayings are older still. I never understood half of what my father told me, and I suspect that neither did he.

The difference between poison and cure is the dose. You tell that to everyone you meet, and tell them you heard it first from Brynden the Wise. People think that all the wisdom worth knowing was written in old valyrian, but I say you can learn twice as much from village midwives and careful examination of nature than from the entire Citadel library. That's why they threw me out of the Citadel, although in retrospect that was a blessing. Anyway, I put that lord back on his feet, and he availed me of a sack of gold and the corpse of a freshly hanged criminal to dissect. Ha! To think of the lengths I had to go to get specimens back in those days.

I think they thought that lord Tytos was so meek he'd just cave over, but they hadn't reckoned with young Tywin. He can't have been more than seventeen at the time! He destroyed their combined armies, and laid siege to Castamere and Tarbeck. When the walls finally fell to his catapults, lady Reyne approached him on her knees, her husband dead, and pleaded for the life of her young sons. Tywin Lannister had their infant bodies put on spikes before her, and then had her executed.

But that's the usual story in these parts, is it not? These fat magisters, archons and what not, they all fear the khalasars, and cover behind their high walls. If they where to properly train an army of pikemen, with archers and crossbowmen behind them, why, I think the next khal to come by would be in for a surprise.

And here's the funny thing -- old lord Harlaw was a fickle man, and he changed his designs a dozen times. Ten Towers is actually ten different castles, welded together. Anyhow, despite this, the castle is surprisingly defendable. I imagine that any enemy would have a hard time conquering this particular piece of the Iron Islands.
Westeros is littered with remnants of the past. Essos too. I guess the world always moves on.
They don't appreciate talent, those fat fish mongers. Bah!

The fact that she had cheated on him drove him mad, and he started to demand the strangest things. In the end he took a new girl every night, only to have her hanged in the morning to prevent her being unfaithfull to him. Everyone in the village just let him get away with it! I'd rather stay out of sight when we pass through here, if you won't mind.
Ever seen a manticore, {playername}? They're supposed to live on an island in the Jade Sea, but the natives refuse to tell us which one.

When the dragonlords descended on prince Garin, he led more than two hundred thousand men against them. They destroyed his army and took him captive, put him in a golden cage, and mocked him. The continued laughing as he called on Mother Rhoyne to drown the invaders, but when the massive tidal wave descended on the invaders, their laughter ceased. It is said that the spirit of the invaders became the shrouded mist that covers these parts, and that prince Garin became the Shrouded Lord.
Non credo che vedano di buon occhio un Parren in mezzo a loro, mio signore. Dobbiamo andarcene da qui.
Supposively, he was quite mad, often pretending to be a vulture himself, going around the castle with feathers stuck to his head, and eating rotten meat.

King Rodrik was the King in the North who challenged the ironborn to a wrestling match over Bear Island. He wrestled a hundred man to the ground, one after the other, until everyone of the reavers where defeated, and left Bear Island. King Rodrik then granted Bear Island to House Mormont, and they've held it as vassals of the Starks ever since.

And I've heard it told that Jaehaerys the Wise called this the most beautiful village in all the realm! And my uncles used to tell me the tale of how the remains of Vermithor, the great wyrm called the Bronze Fury, was buried under that large hill over there!
Chi sono io!
But the Whispers are not named after whispering heads. The sound comes from the sea flooding the caves beneath the cliffs.
Roose always kept tidings from reaching the Starks, but the houses closer to the Dreadfort heard the stories. But what could we do, rebel against our overlords?
Sure, the Sack was horrible, but it's been a generations since the last person lived who could remember it, so I say they'd ought to get over it!
Sono nato in un piccolo villaggio vicino a Summerhall, {playername}

I was born in Duskendale, {playername}, a couple of years before that dreadful defiance business. My entire family was away when lord Darklyn rebelled, else I would not have been here today. Say what you will of Lord Tywin, but if you're going to defy him, you better have an army at your back.
I used to live in my father's house in Oldtown, but I spent much of my childhood in the rivers and the sea, swimming.
My ancestral and glorious home lies in Astapor, looking out over the Bay of Grief, towards the smoking ruins of Valyria.
Sono nato nella bassa pianura del Reach, vicino a Goldengrove.
La mia famiglia vive vicino a Barrowton, ma dubito vogliano avere a che fare con me.
Sono nato in un tugurio nelle paludi, non lontano da {s21}.
I was born on one of the islands adjacent to The Paps. Imagine that, being born on an island less important than The Paps...
Io vengo dalla potente città di Pentos, sicuramente la più pulita tra tutte le Città Libere!
Born and raised in the hills surrounding the Greenblood, {playername}, and I hope to settle down there one day, perhaps in a small manse.
I was born in a small, and I say that with an emphasis, village close to Horn Hill. That makes me a full-blooded reachman, if nothing else.
Oh, my father was a very minor knight, in service to house Crane. Lived most of my life in Oldtown, but now I travel the world in search of medical lore.
Oh, sono effettivamente nato a Ashford, {playername}, anche se con padre sono cresciuto a Standfast.
Sono il figlio più giovane di Khal Ogo.
I'm from Braavos. But Westeros is where the money is to be made, these days, if your trade is siegecraft.

Why, {playername}, I was born in Fairmarket, but my father lost his land to a scheming relative and had to put himself in bond to a nearby lord. That's how I became a squire, a way too soothe my father in his sorrow over loosing our old keep.
Vengo dalla corte di Lys, ma non ci sono più stato da quando ero ragazzo.
Sono scappata da Blackhold, dove l'anziano del villaggio terrorizzava le donne.
I was born in the Queen of Cities. Qarth!
Sono stato impiegato in tutta Essos, sia come guardia che come mercenario.
My father's servant left me as a young boy in Rhaggat Eveth before dropping dead.
Sono nato ad Approdo del Re, ma la mia vera casa è a Cargyll Keep.
Suppongo che vi chiamerò di nuovo.
My home is Chelsted.
Così dolce la carne, così dolce il bambino. Per scolpire, per mangiare, le strisce sono così rosse...
None of your business.
I was born in a small holdfast in the Lonely Hills.
